ArticleTitle.sentence: Constitutive activation of NF-kB in human thymocytes.

event.clue: Constitutive activation of NF-kB in human thymocytes.

AbstractText.sentence: NF-kB is a eukaryotic transcription regulatory factor.
In T cells and T cell lines, NF-kB is bound to a cytoplasmic proteic inhibitor, the IkB.

event.clue: In T cells and T cell lines, NF-kB is bound to a cytoplasmic proteic inhibitor, the IkB.
In T cells and T cell lines, NF-kB is bound to a cytoplasmic proteic inhibitor, the IkB.

AbstractText.sentence: Treatment of T cells with mitogens (phorbol esters) or cytokines (TNF alpha) induces NF-kB nuclear translocation and the subsequent expression of NF-kB dependent T cell genes.

event.clue: Treatment of T cells with mitogens (phorbol esters) or cytokines (TNF alpha) induces NF-kB nuclear translocation and the subsequent expression of NF-kB dependent T cell genes.

AbstractText.sentence: Here we examined the activation of NF-kB in human T cell thymic progenitors.

event.clue: Here we examined the activation of NF-kB in human T cell thymic progenitors.

AbstractText.sentence: We report differences in (Ca2+)i requirement for NF-kB activation in thymocytes as compared to mature T cells.

event.clue: We report differences in (Ca2+)i requirement for NF-kB activation in thymocytes as compared to mature T cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Furthermore, our results indicated that thymocytes have a constitutively active form of NF-kB, suggesting that they are activated in vivo.

event.clue: Furthermore, our results indicated that thymocytes have a constitutively active form of NF-kB, suggesting that they are activated in vivo.
